thread.title: Leonard Fournette will rush for how many yards vs. Eastern Michigan? | Poll
thread.title_full: Leonard Fournette will rush for how many yards vs. Eastern Michigan? | Poll | NOLA.com

author: Jerit Roser, NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune
title: Leonard Fournette will rush for how many yards vs. Eastern Michigan? | Poll
text:
Leonard Fournette will face the nation's worst rush defense, statistically, this weekend.
The LSU running back has averaged 210.3 yards per contest thus far, including 236.0 the past two games, flirting in both with the program's 250-yard single-game record .
Eastern Michigan visits Baton Rouge on Saturday as 45-point underdogs after having allowed 373.3 yards per game to Old Dominion, Wyoming, Ball State and Army.
So, the stage is set.
The Eagles could shock their critics and slow LSU's thus far dominant rushing attack.
Or Fournette could drop the type of stat line usually reserved for video games.
Or, the Tigers could extend their lead quickly enough to rest the sophomore star and other starters for much, if not all, of the second half.
How do you see Saturday playing out?
Vote in the poll below and discuss your rationale in the comments stream below.
